intro: Myrtus bukobensis, commonly known as Bukoban myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to Tanzania and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in montane forests. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. The fruit, which is small and berry-like, is edible and has a mild, sweet flavor.
